revision.comment: migrating [[Wikipedia:Persondata|Persondata]] to Wikidata, [[toollabs:kasparbot/persondata/|please help]], see [[toollabs:kasparbot/persondata/challenge.php/article/Ahmed Mohammed Ali|challenges for this article]]
revision.text:
{{Infobox officeholder |name=Ahmed Mohammed Ali |image= |imagesize= 300px | caption =Ahmed Mohammed Ali with the Egyptian Thunderbolt Forces |office=Media Adviser to the [[President of Egypt|Egyptian President]] |president1= [[Abdel Fattah el-Sisi]] |primeminister1=[[Ibrahim Mahlab]] |term_start1=1 July 2014 |term_end1= |predecessor1=Ahmed el-Moslmani |successor1= |office2=1st Spokesperson for the [[Egyptian Armed Forces]] |president2= [[Muhammed Morsi]]
[[Adly Mansour]]
[[Abdel Fattah el-Sisi]] |primeminister2=[[Hesham Qandil]]
[[Hazem Al Beblawi]]
[[Ibrahim Mahlab]] |term_start2=8 September 2012 |term_end2=1 July 2014 |predecessor2=Vacant |successor2=[[Mohamed Samir]] |allegiance= {{Flag|Egypt}} | branch = [[Egyptian Army]] | serviceyears =1 July 1991-July 2014 |rank= [[File:EgyColonel.png|100px]] [[Egyptian Army ranks|Colonel]] | unit = Infantry | commands = |birth_date= {{birth date|df=yes|1972|11|19}} |birth_place= [[Cairo]] |death_date= |death_place= |religion= [[Sunni Islam]] |battles= [[Sinai insurgency]] | website = }} '''[[Egyptian Army ranks|Colonel]] Ahmed Mohammed Ali''' ([[Arabic]]: '''العقيد أحمد محمد علي'''; also known as '''Ahmed Ali'''; born: 19 November 1972) is the media adviser to the Egyptian president [[Abdel Fattah el-Sisi]] and the ex [[spokesperson]] of the [[Egyptian Army]]. {{cite news|title=Egyptian army's spokesperson garners Facebook 'likes'|author=Roi Kais|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4417161,00.html|newspaper=[[Yediot Ahronot]]|date=13 August 2013|accessdate=8 November 2013}} He was appointed first Army Sopkesman on the backdrop of the deposition of president [[Mohamed Morsi]], and his official Army Spokesman Facebook page exceeded 2,000,000 followers at the time,[https://www.facebook.com/Egy.Army.Spox Official facebook page] and the Egyptian media kept a close and attentive watch of the statuses published by the army, often resulting in army related articles and reports. Ali finished his studies at Egypt's military college in 1991. Afterwards he served in the Egyptian army's infantry corps, where he held various positions, including regiment commander. He then assumed a position with the military college's teaching facility, as well as that of the army's general command and officer's school. ==Qualifications== * Bachelor of Military Sciences from the military College * Bachelor of Military Sciences from [[Royal Military Academy Sandhurst]] * The inevitable Educational brigades of [[infantry]] Unit * [[United States Army Command and General Staff College|US Army Command & General Staff College]], Fort Leavenworth, Kansas 's Course * M.A. of Military Sciences from Commanders and General Staff College * [[School of Advanced Military Studies]], Fort Leavenworth, Kansas 's Course * M.A. of Military Sciences from [[School of Advanced Military Studies]] * [[NATO Defense College]], Rome, IT 's Senior leaders' Course * [[Defense Language Institute]], Lackland Air force Base, Texas 's Diploma in English. ==Orders, decorations and medals== * Military Duty Decoration, Second Third. * Military Duty Decoration, Second Class. * Military Duty Decoration, First Class. * Longevity & Exemplary Medal. * Silver Jubilee of October War Medal. * Golden Jubilee of the 23rd of July Revolution. * Silver Jubilee of The Liberation Of Sinai Medal. * [[File:Brunei General Service Medal.png|55px]] Brunei Medal from [[Royal Military Academy Sandhurst]] * 25 January Revolution Medal. ==References== {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ali, Ahmed Mohammed}} [[Category:Egyptian military personnel]] [[Category:Spokespersons]] [[Category:1972 births]] [[Category:People from Cairo]] [[Category:Egyptian Muslims]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Graduates of the Royal Military Academy Sandhurst]] {{Egypt-stub}} {{Egypt-mil-bio-stub}}
